column4: hello again I STILL have the same problem with executing files. NOTHING works!!! whether they are downloaded from the internet or on backup drives. this is totally unacceptable. I did a fresh install even and STILL no beans
yes
I NEED to execute this file I have a business building aircraft
err virtual aircraft
have you tried chmod +x
bash: ./X-PlaneDVDInstallerLinux: No such file or directory

does it show up in ls?
yes and in the nautilus program
have you tried double-clicking it?
I click it and nothing happens.
yes 64 bit
10.04 .2 LTS amd64
yes
if the binary is 32 bit it might not work
but I need 64 bit in order to access more than one core on the proc
mk but if the program doesn't work on a 64 bit machine then it doesn't matter how many cores you have
Some 32 bit programs are just fine on 32 bit machines, and some aren't
